FuncDef:
The nat session-miss mode drop command enables a device to discard TCP, UDP, and ICMP packets that do not match a NAT policy.
The undo nat session-miss mode drop command restores the default action of processing TCP, UDP, and ICMP packets that do not match a NAT policy.
By default, non-NAT service packets are transmitted transparently.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A service board by default transparently transmits TCP, UDP, and ICMP packets that do not match a NAT policy. To improve network security, disable a device from transparently transmitting non-NAT packets. To meet this requirement, run the nat session-miss mode drop command to enable a device to discard TCP, UDP, and ICMP packets that do not match a NAT policy.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
